lines.gurmukhi: 1 inMdk
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satiguroo Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: kuqw rwj bhwlIAY iPir ckI ctY
lines.transliteration_english: Koutaa Raaji Bahaaleeai Dhiri Chakee Chatai.

Shabad OS B.translation: If a dog is seated on the throne even then it will (like to) lick the flour mill.

lines.gurmukhi: spY duDu pIAwlIAY ivhu muKhu stY
lines.transliteration_english: Sapai Dudhu Peeaaleeai Vihu Moukhahu Satai.

Shabad OS B.translation: If a snake is fed on milk even then it will pour out poison from its mouth.

lines.gurmukhi: pQru pwxI rKIAY min hTu n GtY
lines.transliteration_english: Padaru Paanee Rakheeai Mani Hatdu N Ghatai.

Shabad OS B.translation: If a stone is kept in water even then its hardness does not soften.

lines.gurmukhi: coAw cMdnu pirhrY Kru Kyh pltY
lines.transliteration_english: Choaa Chandanu Pariharai Karu Khayh Palatai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Repudiating the perfume and sandalwood-fragrance, the donkey rolls its body in the dust.

lines.gurmukhi: iqau inMdk pr indhuM hiT mUil n htY
lines.transliteration_english: Tiu Nidak Par Nidahoo Hadi Mooli N Hatai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly the backbiter never gives up (his habit of) backbiting

lines.gurmukhi: Awpx hQI AwpxI jV Awip auptY ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapan Hadeen Aapanee Jarh Aapi Oupatai ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: And uproots himselt to destroy his very existence.

lines.gurmukhi: 2 inMdk

Shabad OS B.translation: The backbiter

lines.gurmukhi: kwauN kpUr nw cKeI durgMiD suKwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Kaaoun Kapoor N Chakhaee Duragandhi Soukhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Crow never picks up camphor; it likes to have garbage around.

lines.gurmukhi: hwQI nIir nHvwlIAY isir Cwru aufwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Haadee Neeri Nhavaaleeai Siri Chhaaru Udaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The elephant even bathed in water puts dust on its head.

lines.gurmukhi: quMmy AMmiRq isMjIAY kauVqu n jwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Tounmay Anmrit Sinjeeai Kaurhatu N Jaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The colocynth (tumma) even if irrigated with nectar does not part with its bitterness.

lines.gurmukhi: ismlu ruKu sryvIAY Plu hiQ nw AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Simalu Roukhu Sarayveeai Phalu Hadi N Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even if the silk-cotton tree is well served (with water and manure etc.), no fruit is gained from it.

lines.gurmukhi: inMdku nwm ivhUixAw siqsMg nw BwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Nidaku Naam Vihooniaa Satisang N Bhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The backbiters being devoid of the neim of the Lord, do not like the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: AMnHw AwgU jy QIAY sBu swQu muhwvY ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Annhaa Aagoo Jay Deeai Sabhu Saadu Muhaavai ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: If the leader is blind, the whole company is bound to be robbed of (their valuables).

lines.gurmukhi: 3 inMdk

Shabad OS B.translation: The backbiter

lines.gurmukhi: lsxu lukwieAw nw lukY bih KwjY kUxY
lines.transliteration_english: Lasanu Loukaaiaa Naa Loukay Bahi Khaajai Koonai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The smell of garlic cannot be concealed even if it is eaten in a remote corner.

lines.gurmukhi: kwlw kMblu aujlw ikauN hoie sbUxY
lines.transliteration_english: Kaalaa Kanbalu Ujalaa Kioun Hoi Saboonai.

Shabad OS B.translation: No soap how so much applied, can turn the black blanket into white.

lines.gurmukhi: fymU KKr jo CuhY idsY muih sUxY
lines.transliteration_english: Daymoo Khakhar Jo Chhoohai Disai Muhi Soonai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Whosoever will touch the hive of poisonous wasps will find his face swollen.

lines.gurmukhi: ikqY kMim nw AwveI lwvxu ibnu lUxY
lines.transliteration_english: Kitai Kanmi N Aavaee Laavanu Binu Loonai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The cooked vegetable devoid of salt is absolutely useless.

lines.gurmukhi: inMdik nwm ivswirAw gur igAwnu ivhUxY
lines.transliteration_english: Nidaki Naam Visaariaa Gur Giaanu Vihoonai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Without the knowledge of the true Guru, the backbiter has neglected the name of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: hliq pliq suKu nw lhY duKIAw isru JUxY ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Halati Palati Soukhu Naa Lahai Doukheeaa Siru Jhoonai ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: He gets happiness neither here nor there and always laments and repents.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 gur inMdw

Shabad OS B.translation: Vilification of the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: fwiexu mwxs KwvxI puqu burw n mMgY
lines.transliteration_english: Daainu Maanas Khaavanee Poutu Buraa N Mangai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The witch is man eater but she also does not contemplate wrong for her son.

lines.gurmukhi: vfw ivkrmI AwKIAY DI BYxhu sMgY
lines.transliteration_english: Vadaa Vikaramee Aakheeai Dhee Bhainahu Sangai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even known as the most vicious man, he also feels ashamed before his daughter and sister.

lines.gurmukhi: rwjy DRohu kmwNvdy rYbwr surMgY
lines.transliteration_english: Raajay Dhrohu Kamaanvaday Raibaar Surangai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The kings, trecherous for each other, put no harm to the amabassadors (and they live comfortably).

lines.gurmukhi: bjr pwp n auqrin jwie kIcin gMgY
lines.transliteration_english: Bajar Paap N Outarani Jaai Keechani Gangai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The sins committed at Ganges (the religious places) are as hard as the thunderbolt and never fade out.

lines.gurmukhi: Qrhr kMbY nrku jmu suix inMdk FMgY
lines.transliteration_english: Darahar Kanbai Naraku Jamu Souni Nidak Nagai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Listening to the naked meanness of the slanderer, Yama of the hell also trembles.

lines.gurmukhi: inMdw BlI n iksY dI gur inMd kuFMgY ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Nidaa Bhalee N Kisai Dee Gur Nid Kuddhangai ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: Backbiting of any one is bad but the vilification of the Guru is the worst (way of life).

lines.gurmukhi: 5 gur inMdw dy diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Examples of Guru's vilification

lines.gurmukhi: inMdw kir hrxwKsY vyKhu Plu vty
lines.transliteration_english: Nidaa Kari Harakhaanasai Vaykhahu Phalu Vatai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Hirrtyakyapu talked adversely about God and the result gained is clear that he eventually got killed.

lines.gurmukhi: lMk lutweI rwvxY msqik ds kty
lines.transliteration_english: Lak Loutaaee Raavanai Masataki Das Katai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ravan also for the same reason got Lanka looted and his ten heads slayed.

lines.gurmukhi: kMsu gieAw sx lskrY sB dYq sMGty
lines.transliteration_english: Kansu Gaiaa San Lasakarai Sabh Dait Sanghatai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Kans was killed along with his full army and his all the demons perished.

lines.gurmukhi: vMsu gvwieAw kYrvwN KUhix lK Pty
lines.transliteration_english: Vansu Gavaaiaa Kairavaan Khoohani Lakh Dhatai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Kauravas lost their dynasty and got their myriads of army destroyed.

lines.gurmukhi: dMq bkqR isspwl dy dMd hoey Kty
lines.transliteration_english: Dant Bakatr Sisapaal Day Dand Hoay Khatai.

Shabad OS B.translation: For the same reason, Dantavaktr and Siupál got crushing defeat.

lines.gurmukhi: inMdw koie n isiJE ieau vyd auGty
lines.transliteration_english: Nidaa Koi N Sijhiao Iu Vayd Oughatai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Vedas also dilineate that no success is possible through back-biting

lines.gurmukhi: durbwsy ny srwp dy Xwdv sB qty ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Durabaasay Nay Saraap Day Yaadav Sabhi Tatai ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: . (Due to this vilification) Durvasà. cursed Yadays and vanquished them all.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 gur dI gxq gxn vwlw duKI

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru's fault finder always suffers

lines.gurmukhi: sBnw dy isr guMdIAin gMjI gurVwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabhanaan Day Sir Goundeeani Ganjee Gurarhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The hairs of all are dressed but the bald lady mumbles.

lines.gurmukhi: kMin qnauVy kwmxI bUVI birVwvy
lines.transliteration_english: Kanni Tanaurhay Kaamanee Boorhee Barirhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The beautiful woman wears the earnings but the earless one grumbles.

lines.gurmukhi: nQwN nik nvylIAwN nktI n suKwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Nadaan Naki Navayleeaan Nakatee N Soukhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The newly wed girls wear nose rings but the noseless feels uncomfortable (for not being able to wear nose ring).

lines.gurmukhi: kjl AKI hrxwKIAwN kwxI kurlwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Kajal Akheen Haranaakheeaan Kaanee Kuralaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The deer-eyed ladies put in the collyrium but the one-eyed wails and cries.

lines.gurmukhi: sBnw cwl suhwvxI lMgVI lMgVwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabhanaan Chaal Suhaavanee Lagarhee Lagarhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: All have a pleasing gait but the lame limps.

lines.gurmukhi: gxq gxY gurdyv dI iqsu duiK ivhwvY ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Ganat Ganai Guradayv Dee Tisu Doukhi Vihaavai ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: Those who slander the Guru, spend their life in sorrows.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 gurU inMdk dw jnm AkwrQ

Shabad OS B.translation: The life of Guru-slanderer is meaningless

lines.gurmukhi: Apqu krIru nw maulIAY dy dosu bsMqY
lines.transliteration_english: Apatu Kareeru N Mauleeai Day Dosu Basantai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The leafless wild caper Karin does not grow green but it blames the spring season.

lines.gurmukhi: sMiF spuqI nw QIAY kxqwvY kMqY
lines.transliteration_english: Sanddhi Sapoutee N Deeai Kanataavai Kantai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The barren women does not bear the child but she blames her husband.

lines.gurmukhi: klir Kyqu nw jMmeI Gxhru vrsMqY
lines.transliteration_english: Kalari Khaytu N Janmaee Ghanaharu Varasantai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The rains of the clouds cannot make alkaline field grow and produce.

lines.gurmukhi: pMgw ipCY cMigAwN Avgux guxvMqY
lines.transliteration_english: Pangaa Pichhai Changiaan Avagoun Gounavantai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The meritorious people get evils and embarrassments in the company of vicious people.

lines.gurmukhi: swieru ivic GMGUitAwN bhu rqn AnMqY
lines.transliteration_english: Saairu Vichi Ghanghootiaan Bahu Ratan Anatai.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the ocean, one gets many a pearl even from the shells, i.e. the association with the good produces good results.

lines.gurmukhi: jnm gvwie AkwrQw guru gxq gxMqY ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Janam Gavaai Akaaradaa Guru Ganat Ganantai ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: Slandering the Guru, the whole life elapses in vain.

lines.gurmukhi: 8 AikrqGx

Shabad OS B.translation: The ungrateful

lines.gurmukhi: nw iqsu Bwry prbqwN Asmwn KhMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Naa Tisu Bhaaray Parabataan Asamaan Khahanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The sky-touching mountains also are not of much weight (than the ungrateful person).

lines.gurmukhi: nw iqsu Bwry kot gVH Grbwr idsMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Naa Tisu Bhaaray Kot Garhh Ghar Baar Disanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The visible forts are also not as weighty as he (the ungrateful person) is;

lines.gurmukhi: nw iqsu Bwry swierwN nd vwh vhMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Naa Tisu Bhaaray Saairaan Nad Vaah Vahanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Those oceans in which will the rivers merge are also not as heavy as he is;

lines.gurmukhi: nw iqsu Bwry qruvrwN Pl suPl PlMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Naa Tisu Bhaaray Taruvaraan Phal Suphal Phaladay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The fruit laden trees are also not as heavy as he is

lines.gurmukhi: nw iqsu Bwry jIAjMq Axgxq iPrMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Naa Tisu Bhaaray Jeea Jant Anaganat Dhiranday.

Shabad OS B.translation: And nor those innumerable creatures are as heavy as he is.

lines.gurmukhi: Bwry BueIN AikrqGx mMdI hU mMdy ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaaray Bhueen Akirataghan Mandee Hoo Manday.

Shabad OS B.translation: In fact the ungrateful person is burden on earth and he is evil of evils.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 AikrqGx

Shabad OS B.translation: Example of an ungrateful

lines.gurmukhi: md ivic irDw pwiekY kuqy dw mwsu
lines.transliteration_english: Mad Vichi Ridhaa Paai Kai Koutay Daa Maasu.

Shabad OS B.translation: The meat of dog cooked in the wine was, along with its foul smell, kept in the human skull.

lines.gurmukhi: DirAw mwxs KoprI iqsu mMdI vwsu
lines.transliteration_english: Dhariaa Maanas Khoparee Tisu Mandee Vaasu.

Shabad OS B.translation: It was covered with the blood stained cloth.

lines.gurmukhi: rqU BirAw kpVw kir kjxu qwsu
lines.transliteration_english: Ratoo Bhariaa Kaparhaa Kari Kajanu Taasu.

Shabad OS B.translation: Covering thus, the scavenger woman (chi:than) after appeasing her lust was carrying that bowl.

lines.gurmukhi: Fik lY clI cUhVI kir Bog iblwsu
lines.transliteration_english: Ddhaki Lai Chalee Chooharhee Kari Bhog Bilaasu.

Shabad OS B.translation: On being asked about (the abominable covered material)

lines.gurmukhi: AwiK suxwey puiCAw lwhy ivsvwsu
lines.transliteration_english: Aakhi Sounaaay Pouchhiaa Laahay Visavaasu.

Shabad OS B.translation: She cleared the doubt by saying that she had covered the meat to hide

lines.gurmukhi: ndrI pvY AikrqGxu mqu hoie ivxwsu ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Nadaree Pavai Akirataghanu Matu Hoi Vinaasu ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: It from the sight of an ungrateful person to avoid its pollution.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 lUx hrwmI

Shabad OS B.translation: The ungrateful

lines.gurmukhi: coru gieAw Gir swh dY Gr AMdir viVAw
lines.transliteration_english: Choru Gaiaa Ghari Saah Dai Ghar Andari Varhiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: A thief entered the house of a rich person.

lines.gurmukhi: kuCw kUxY Bwldw caubwry cViHAw
lines.transliteration_english: Kouchhaa Koonai Bhaaladaa Chaoubaaray Charhhiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Carefully watching the four corners he came to the upper room.

lines.gurmukhi: suienw rupw pMf bMniH AglweI AiVAw
lines.transliteration_english: Suinaa Roupaa Pand Bannhi Agalaaee Arhiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He gathered the money and gold and tied them in a bundle; but still his greed delayed him.

lines.gurmukhi: loB lhir hlkwieAw lUx hwNfw PiVAw
lines.transliteration_english: Lobh Lahari Halakaaiaa Loon Haandaa Dharhiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Getting impatient in greed he caught hold of a salt-pot.

lines.gurmukhi: cuKku lY ky ciKAw iqsu kKu n KiVAw
lines.transliteration_english: Choukhaku Lai Kay Chakhiaa Tisu Kakhu N Kharhiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: A bit of it he took out and tasted; he left every thing there and came, out.

lines.gurmukhi: lUx hrwmI gunhgwru DVu DMmV DiVAw ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Loon Haraamee Gounahagaaru Dharhu Dhanmarh Dharhiaa ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: That thief also knew, that an ungrateful person is beaten like a drum (in the Lord's court).

lines.gurmukhi: 11 lUx KwixAwN dI igxqI

Shabad OS B.translation: The number of the faithful ones

lines.gurmukhi: KwDy lUx gulwm hoie pIih pwxI FovY
lines.transliteration_english: Khaadhay Loon Gulaam Hoi Peehi Paanee Ddhovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having eaten the salt (of a person), man becoming servant fetches water and grinds the corn.

lines.gurmukhi: lUx Kwie kir cwkrI rix tuk tuk hovY
lines.transliteration_english: Loon Khaai Kari Chaakaree Rani Touk Touk Hovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Such a faithful, in the battlefield gets killed piece to piece for the master.

lines.gurmukhi: lUx Kwie DI puqu hoie sB ljw DovY
lines.transliteration_english: Loon Khaai Dhee Poutu Hoi Sabh Lajaa Dhovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The faithful sons and daughters wash all the shames of the family.

lines.gurmukhi: lUxu vxotw Kwie kY hQ joiV KVovY
lines.transliteration_english: Loonu Vanotaa Khaai Kai Had Jorhi Kharhovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The salt eater servant always stands with folded hands.

lines.gurmukhi: vwt vtwaU lUxu Kwie guxu kMiT provY
lines.transliteration_english: Vaat Vataaoo Loonu Khaai Gounu Kantdi Parovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The passerby eulogizes the person whose salt be has eaten.

lines.gurmukhi: lUx hrwmI gunhgwr mir jnmu ivgovY ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Loon Haraamee Gounahagaar Mari Janamu Vigovai ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: But the ungrateful person commits sins and he loses his life in vain and dies.

lines.gurmukhi: 12 Drmswl dI Jwk

Shabad OS B.translation: Expectation from a religious place

lines.gurmukhi: ijau imrjwdw ihMdUAwN gaU mwsu AKwju
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Mirayaadaa Hindooaa Gaoo Maasu Akhaaju.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the cow meat is forbidden in Hindu code of conduct;

lines.gurmukhi: muslmwxw sUArhu saugMd ivAwju
lines.transliteration_english: Mousalamaanaan Sooarahu Saougand Viaaju.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Musalmans pledge against the pork and the interest on money;

lines.gurmukhi: shurw Gir jwvweIAY pwxI md rwju
lines.transliteration_english: Sahuraa Ghari Javaaeeai Paanee Mudaraaju.

Shabad OS B.translation: For father-in-law, even the water of the house of son-in-law is prohibited like the wine;

lines.gurmukhi: shw n KweI cUhVw mwieAw muhqwju
lines.transliteration_english: Sahaa N Khaaee Chooharhaa Maaiaa Muhataaju.

Shabad OS B.translation: The scanvenger eats not rabbit, though he be hard of money;

lines.gurmukhi: ijau imTY mKI mrY iqsu hoie Akwju
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Mitdai Makhee Marai Tisu Hoi Akaaju.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the dead fly makes the taste of sweet bad and the sweet getting poisonous becomes useless,

lines.gurmukhi: iqau Drmswl dI Jwk hY ivhu KMfUpwju ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Tiu Dharamasaal Dee Jhaak Hai Vihu Khandoo Paaju ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly to set one's eye upon the earning of the religious place is like eating of sugar coated poison.

lines.gurmukhi: 13 Jwk - pUjw dw Dwn

Shabad OS B.translation: Desire from the earning of the religious place -

lines.gurmukhi: Krw duhylw jg ivic ijs AMdir Jwku
lines.transliteration_english: Kharaa Duhaylaa Jag Vichi Jis Andari Jhaaku.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is ever sorrowful who has craving in his mind.

lines.gurmukhi: soieny no hQu pwiedw huie vM\\\\Y Kwku
lines.transliteration_english: Soinay No Hadu Paaidaa Hui Vanai Khaaku.

Shabad OS B.translation: He touches the gold and that turns into the lump of soil.

lines.gurmukhi: ieT imq puq Bwierw ivhrin sB swku
lines.transliteration_english: Itd Mit Pout Bhaairaa Viharani Sabh Saaku.

Shabad OS B.translation: Dear friends, sons, brothers, and all other relatives become unhappy with him.

lines.gurmukhi: sogu ivjogu srwpu hY durmiq nwpwku
lines.transliteration_english: Sogu Vijogu Saraapu Hai Duramati Naapaaku.

Shabad OS B.translation: Such evil-minded person ever suffers the curse of meeting and separation i.e. he undergoes the sufferings of transmigration.

lines.gurmukhi: vqY muqiV rMn ijau dir imlY qlwku
lines.transliteration_english: Vatai Moutarhi Rann Jiu Dari Milai Talaaku.

Shabad OS B.translation: He wanders like an abandoned woman and stands divorced from the door (of the Lod).

lines.gurmukhi: duKu BuKu dwild Gxw dojk Aauqwku ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Doukhu Bhoukhu Daalid Ghanaa Dojak Aoutaaku ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: He gets distress, hunger, profuse poverty and reaches hell after the (bodily) death.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 pUjw dw Dwn

Shabad OS B.translation: Earnings of worship

lines.gurmukhi: ivgVY cwtw duD dw kwNjI dI cuKY
lines.transliteration_english: Vigarhai Chaataa Dudh Daa Kaanjee Dee Choukhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The full pot of milk gets spoiled by a drop of vinegar.

lines.gurmukhi: shs mxw rUeI jlY icxgwrI DuKY
lines.transliteration_english: Sahas Manaa Rooee Jalai Chinagaaree Dhoukhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The thousand mounds of cotton are burnt by one spark.

lines.gurmukhi: bUru ivxwhy pwxIAY Kau lwKhu ruKY
lines.transliteration_english: Booru Vinaahay Paaneeai Khau Laakhahu Roukhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The water gossamer spoils water and the shellac becomes the reason for the destruction of the tree.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau audmwdI AqIswru KeI rogu mnuKY
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Udamaadee Ateesaaru Khaee Rogu Manoukhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The mad man is mined by diarrhoea and the common man is destroyed by tuberculosis (consumption).

lines.gurmukhi: ijau jwil pMKyrU Pwsdy cugx dI BuKY
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Jaali Pankhayroo Dhaasaday Chougan Dee Bhoukhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the birds get entangled in the net out of their greed for seeds,

lines.gurmukhi: iqau Ajru Jwk BMfwr dI ivAwpy vymuKY ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Tiu Ajaru Jhaak Bhandaar Dee Viaapay Vaymoukhai ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: The desire for the storage of unendurable (earning from the religious place) persists in the heart of the apostate.

lines.gurmukhi: 15 pUjw dw Dwn ik`kUM pcy

Shabad OS B.translation: How earnings of worship could be digested     ?

lines.gurmukhi: Aaucru Jwk BMfwr dI cuKu lgY cKI
lines.transliteration_english: Aoucharu Jhaak Bhandaar Dee Choukhu Lagai Chakhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: To crave for the material of store (for the Sikhs) is improper.

lines.gurmukhi: hoie dukuDw inklY Bojnu imil mKI
lines.transliteration_english: Hoi Doukudhaa Nikalai Bhojanu Mili Makhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: But those who have such a desire, have to return the material, as the fly gone inside with food is vomited out by the body.

lines.gurmukhi: rwiq suKwlw ikau svY iqxu AMdir AKI
lines.transliteration_english: Raati Soukhaalaa Kiu Savai Tinu Andari Akhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: How could he sleep peacefully who has the grass blade in his eye.

lines.gurmukhi: kKw dbI Aig ijau Ehu rhY n rKI
lines.transliteration_english: Kakhaa Dabee Agi Jiu Aohu Rahai N Rakhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the fire cannot be kept pressed under the dry grass, similarly,

lines.gurmukhi: Jwk JkweIAY Jwkvwlu kir BK ABKI
lines.transliteration_english: Jhaak Jhakaaeeai Jhaakavaalu Kari Bhakh Abhakhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The cravings of the caving person cannot be controlled and for him the inedible becomes edible.

lines.gurmukhi: gur prswdI aubry gur isKw lKI ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Parasaadee Oubaray Gur Sikhaa Lakhee ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikhs of the Guru are millions but only those who attain the grace of the Lord get across  the world ocean).

lines.gurmukhi: 16 Drmswl JwkIAwN dw l`Cx

Shabad OS B.translation: The marks of the religious-earning-grabbers

lines.gurmukhi: ijau Gux KwDI lkVI ivxu qwix inqwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Ghoun Khaadhee Lakarhee Vinu Taani Nitaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He (the apostate) becomes feeble and powerless as the weevil-eaten wood.

lines.gurmukhi: jwxu frwvw Kyq ivic inrjIau prwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaanu Daraavaa Khayt Vichi Nirajeetu Paraanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is similar to the life-less scarecrow put up in the field to frighten (the birds).

lines.gurmukhi: ijau DUAru JVuvwl dI ikau vrsY pwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Dhooaru Jharhuvaal Dee Kiu Varasai Paanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: How out of clouds of smoke rain could take place.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau Qx gl ivic bkrI duih duDu nw AwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Dan Gal Vichi Bakaree Duhi Dudhu N Aanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the teat of a goat in the neck cannot give milk, likewise the grabber of religious earning of a religious place roams hither and thither in the craving of the same.

lines.gurmukhi: Jwky AMdir Jwkvwlu iqs ikAw nIswxI
lines.transliteration_english: Jhaakay Andari Jhaakavaalu Tis Kiaa Neesaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: What is the exact mark of such a man.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau cmuctY gwie mih auh Brim BulwxI ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Chamu Chatai Gaai Mahi Uh Bharami Bhulaanee ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: Such a man remains deluded like that cow who considering its dead offspiring alive goes on licking it

lines.gurmukhi: 17 swD AswD pRICw

Shabad OS B.translation: Test of the saint and the renegade

lines.gurmukhi: guCw hoie DiRkwnUAw ikau vuVIAY dwKY
lines.transliteration_english: Gouchhaa Hoi Dhrikaanooaa Kiu Varheeai Daakhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Why should the bunch of the bead tree be compared with grapes.

lines.gurmukhi: AkY kyrI KKVI koeI AMbu nw AwKY
lines.transliteration_english: Akai Kayree Khakharhee Koee Anbu N Aakhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: No one calls the akk berries, mango.

lines.gurmukhi: ghxy ijauN jrpos dy nhI soienw swKY
lines.transliteration_english: Gahanay Jiu Jarapos Day Nahee Soinaa Saakhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gift ornaments are not like golden ornaments.

lines.gurmukhi: Ptk n pujin hIirAw Eie Bry ibAwKY
lines.transliteration_english: Dhatak N Pujani Heeriaa Aoi Bharay Biaakhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Crystals are not equal to diamonds because the diamonds are costlier.

lines.gurmukhi: Dauly idsin Cwih duDu swdhu gux gwKY
lines.transliteration_english: Dhaulay Disani Chhaahi Dudhu Saadahu Goun Gaakhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Butter milk and milk are both white but of different quality and taste

lines.gurmukhi: iqau swD AswD prKIAin krqUiq su BwKY ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Tiu Saadh Asaadh Parakheeani Karatooti Su Bhaakhai ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, the holy and unholy are distinguished by their attributes and activities.

lines.gurmukhi: 18 cwr vrx dw swD

Shabad OS B.translation: The saints among the four varnas

lines.gurmukhi: swvy pIly pwn hih Eie vylhu qutY
lines.transliteration_english: Saavay Peelay Paan Hahi Aoi Vaylahu Toutay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The betel leaves when plucked from the branch are of green and yellow colour.

lines.gurmukhi: icqimqwly PoPly Pl ibrKhuN CutY
lines.transliteration_english: Chitamitaalay Dhophalay Phal Birakhahoun Chhoutay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The betel nut getting pie bald colour is plucked from the tree.

lines.gurmukhi: kQ huryhI BUslI dy cwvl cutY
lines.transliteration_english: Kad Harayhee Bhoosalee Day Chaaval Choutay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The catechu is of brown colour and light and a pinch of it is used.

lines.gurmukhi: cUnw idsY aujlw dih pQru kutY
lines.transliteration_english: Choonaa Disai Ujalaa Dahi Padaru Koutay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The lime is white and is burnt and thrashed.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpu gvwie smwie imil rMgu cIc vhutY
lines.transliteration_english: Aapu Gavaai Samaai Mili Rangu Cheech Vahoutay.

Shabad OS B.translation: When losing their ego (they meet) they uniformally become of red colour.

lines.gurmukhi: iqau chu vrnw ivic swD hin gurmuiK muh jutY ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Tiu Chahu Varanaa Vichi Saadh Hani Guramoukhi Muh Joutay ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: Likewise are the saints, who adopting the qualifies of the four varnas, live in mutual love like gmmukhs, the Guru oriented.

lines.gurmukhi: 19 swNgI swD

Shabad OS B.translation: Hypocrite saint

lines.gurmukhi: cwkr sB sdwieNdy swihb drbwry
lines.transliteration_english: Chaakar Sabh Sadaainday Saahib Darabaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the court of the emperor all are known as servants.

lines.gurmukhi: iniv iniv krin juhwrIAw sB sY hQIAwry
lines.transliteration_english: Nivi Nivi Karani Juhaareeaa Sabh Saihadeeaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Armed well, they bow most humbly.

lines.gurmukhi: mjls bih bwPwieNdy bol bolin Bwry
lines.transliteration_english: Majalas Bahi Baadhaainday Bol Bolani Bhaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the social and cultural gatherings they boast and brag.

lines.gurmukhi: glIey qury ncwieNdy gjgwh svwry
lines.transliteration_english: Galeeay Turay Nachaainday Gajagaah Savaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: They have their elephants decorated and in the streets and bazars they roam with their horses dancing.

lines.gurmukhi: rx ivic pieAwN jwxIAin joD Bjxhwry
lines.transliteration_english: Ran Vichi Paiaan Jaaneeani Jodh Bhajanahaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: But only in the battle field is known who is a valiant fighter and who is to take to his heels.

lines.gurmukhi: iqau swNig is\\\\wpin snmuKw bymuK hiqAwry ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Tiu Saangi Siaapani Sanamoukhaan Baymoukh Hatiaaray ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similar are the apostates, the assassins who disguised as close to the Lord remain around, but ultimately are identified.

lines.gurmukhi: 20 gurU swNg

Shabad OS B.translation: The test by the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: jy mwN hovY jwrnI ikau puqu pqwry
lines.transliteration_english: Jay Maan Hovai Jaaranee Kiu Poutu Pataaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: If the mother is adulteress why should son speak ill of her.

lines.gurmukhi: gweI mwxku ingilAw pytu pwiV n mwry
lines.transliteration_english: Gaaee Maanaku Nigaliaa Paytu Paarhi N Maaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: If a gem is swallowed by a cow, nobody ripps its stomach to get it out.

lines.gurmukhi: jy ipru bhu Gru hMFxw squ rKY nwry
lines.transliteration_english: Jay Piru Bahu Gharu Handdhanaa Satu Rakhai Naaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: If the husband enjoys (immorally) at many houses, the wife should preserve her chastity.

lines.gurmukhi: Amru clwvY cMm dy cwkr vycwry
lines.transliteration_english: Amaru Chalaavai Chanm Day Chaakar Vaychaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: If the king exercises dictatorial powers, the servants are helpless before him.

lines.gurmukhi: jy mdu pIqw bwmHxI loie luJix swry
lines.transliteration_english: Jay Madu Peetaa Baamhanee Loi Lujhani Saaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: If a brahmin woman is drunk, all feel ashamed and donot look up in her face.

lines.gurmukhi: jy gur swNig vrqdw isKu isdku nhwry ]20]
lines.transliteration_english: Jay Gur Saangi Varatadaa Sikhu Sidaku N Haaray ?20?

Shabad OS B.translation: If the Guru performs a sham, the Sikh should not give up his forebearance.

lines.gurmukhi: 21 swNg ivc swbq ivrly

Shabad OS B.translation: Rare pass the test

lines.gurmukhi: DrqI aupir kotgV Buiecwl kMmMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Dharatee Oupari Kot Garh Bhuichaal Kamanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: During the earth quake millions of forts on earth shake and crumble

lines.gurmukhi: JKiV Awey qruvrw srbq hlMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Jhakharhi Aaay Taruvaraa Sarabat Haladay.

Shabad OS B.translation: During the storm, all the trees oscillate.

lines.gurmukhi: fiv lgY aujwiV ivic sB Gwh jlMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Davi Lagai Ujaarhi Vichi Sabh Ghaah Jaladay.

Shabad OS B.translation: During fire, all sorts of grass in the forests get burnt.

lines.gurmukhi: hV Awey ikin QMmIAin drIAwau vhMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Harh Aaay Kini Danmeeani Dareeaau Vahanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Who can obstruct flood in the flowing river.

lines.gurmukhi: AMbir pwty iQglI kUiVAwr krMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Anbari Paatay Digalee Koorhiaar Karanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The difficult and foolish task of sewing the torn sky like cloth could be done only by adepts in gossipping.

lines.gurmukhi: swNgY AMdir swbqy sy ivrly bMdy ]21]
lines.transliteration_english: Saangai Andari Saabatay Say Viralay Banday ?21?

Shabad OS B.translation: Rare are the people who remain completely poised during the sham.

lines.gurmukhi: 22 swNg ivc swbqI gurU kiRpw qy

Shabad OS B.translation: If the Guru performs a sham what a Sikh can do ?

lines.gurmukhi: jy mwau puqY ivsu dy iqsqy iksu ipAwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Jay Maau Poutai Visu Day Tis Tay Kisu Piaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: If a mother administers poison to son then to whom else that son could be more dear.

lines.gurmukhi: jy Gru BMnY pwhrU kauxu rKxhwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Jay Gharu Bhannai Paaharoo Kaounu Rakhanahaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: If the watchman breaks open the house, then, who else could be a protector.

lines.gurmukhi: byVI fobY pwqxI ikau pwir auqwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Bayrhaa Dobai Paatanee Kiu Paari Outaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: If the boatman makes the boat sink, how one could get across.

lines.gurmukhi: AwgU lY auJiV pvY iksu krY pukwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Aagoo Lai Ujharhi Pavay Kisu Karai Poukaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: If the leader himself makes the people go astray, who else could be called for help.

lines.gurmukhi: jy kir KyqY Kwie vwiV ko lhY n swrw
lines.transliteration_english: Jay Kari Khaytai Khaai Vaarhi Ko Lahai N Saaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: And if the protecting fence starts eating the crops who else will take care of the fields.

lines.gurmukhi: jy gur Brmwey swNgu kir ikAw isKu ivcwrw ]22]
lines.transliteration_english: Jay Gur Bharamaaay Saangu Kari Kiaa Sikhu Vichaaraa ?22?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, if the Guru deludes a Sikh through a sham, what a poor Sikh could do.

lines.gurmukhi: 23 auho hI

Shabad OS B.translation: Only he remains poised in a sham whom the Guru is graceful

lines.gurmukhi: jl ivic kwgd lUx ijau iGA copiV pwey
lines.transliteration_english: Jal Vichi Kaagad Loon Jiu Ghia Choparhi Paaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Applying butter to the paper and salt they can be put into water (they will take longer time to dissolve).

lines.gurmukhi: dIvy vtI qylu dy sB rwiq jlwey
lines.transliteration_english: Deevay Vatee Taylu Day Sabh Raati Jalaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: With the help of oil, the wick of the lamp goes on burning the whole night.

lines.gurmukhi: vwie mMfl ijau for PiV gufI Efwey
lines.transliteration_english: Vaai Mandal Jiu Dor Dharhi Gudee Aodaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Catching hold of the string, the kite could be made to fly in the sky.

lines.gurmukhi: muh ivic grV dugwru pwie ijau spu lVwey
lines.transliteration_english: Muh Vichi Gararh Dougaaru Paai Jiu Sapu Larhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: By keeping an herb in the mouth, one could get bitten by serpent.

lines.gurmukhi: rwjw iPrY PkIru hoie suix duiK imtwey
lines.transliteration_english: Raajaa Dhirai Dhakeeru Hoi Souni Doukhi Mitaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: If the king goes out in the guise of a faquire, he could listen to the sufferings of people and remove them.

lines.gurmukhi: swNgY AMdir swbqw ijsu gurU shwey ]23]35]
lines.transliteration_english: Saangai Andari Saabataa Jisu Guroo Sahaaay ?23?35?painteeha?

Shabad OS B.translation: In such a feat only he passes the test who is helped by the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: rom rom koit biHmwNf ko invws jwsu mwns Aauqwr Dwr drs idKwey hY
lines.transliteration_english: Rom Rom Koti Brahimaand Ko Nivaas Jaasu , Maanas Aoutaar Dhaar Daras Dikhaaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Supreme Lord, whose each hair support millions of cosmos has incarnated as Satguru in human form.

lines.gurmukhi: jw ky EAMkwr kY Akwr hY nwnw pRkwr sRImuK sbd gur isKnu sunwey hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaa Kay Aoankaar Kai Akaar Hai Naanaa Prakaara , Sreemoukh Sabad Gur Sikhanu Sounaaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Omniprotector Lord who has many forms, appearing as Guru has given sermon to his disciples in person.

lines.gurmukhi: jg Bog neIbyd jgq Bgq jwih Asn bsn gurisKn lfwey hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jag Bhog Naeebayd Jagat Bhagat Jaahi , Asan Basan Gursikhan Ladaaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The God for whose propitiation yags are performed, food and offerings are made, the same Lord takes the form of Guru now coddling his Sikhs by distributing food and to his disciples.

lines.gurmukhi: ingm syKwid kbq nyq nyq kir pUrm bHm gurisKnu lKwey hY ]35]
lines.transliteration_english: Nigam Saykhaadi Kabat Nayt Nayt Kari , Pooram Braham Gursikhanu Lakhaaay Hai ?35?

Shabad OS B.translation: The supreme Creator, whom Shesh Nag and others have calling by innumerable names, now manifests as Guru showing Himself to His devotees (The Sikhs). (35)
